documentType: internal affairs referral / BOP incident report
summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons Office of Internal Affairs referral to the DOJ OIG regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York on August 10, 2019. It details the incident, alleges staff misconduct (failure to conduct required rounds), and identifies involved staff and the victim.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York's Special Housing Unit on August 10, 2019, and pronounced dead at a local hospital. His death is the subject of the internal affairs investigation.

persons.name: Operations Lieutenant
persons.context: The officer who responded to the medical emergency, witnessed the scene, administered CPR, and reported conversations with the correctional officers involved.

persons.name: Correctional Officer
persons.context: One of the subjects of the internal investigation. Admitted to not conducting the 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. rounds and stated 'we messed up' to the Operations Lieutenant.

persons.name: Materials Handler Supervisor
persons.context: One of the subjects of the internal investigation. Also admitted to not conducting the required rounds.

persons.name: Union President
persons.context: The person the involved staff members wanted to contact to review any memorandums they would have to write about the incident.

connections.description: Both were on duty and allegedly failed together to conduct the 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts/rounds on the night of Epstein's death.
The Correctional Officer had custodial and supervisory responsibility for inmate Epstein, including conducting security rounds.
The Materials Handler Supervisor had custodial and supervisory responsibility for inmate Epstein, including conducting security rounds.
The officer, along with their colleague, stated they wanted to contact the Union President for representation regarding writing incident memorandums.

connections.context: The Operations Lieutenant interviewed the Correctional Officer about the incident and received their admission of failure to conduct rounds.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at approximately 6:33 a.m. CPR was administered, and he was transported to a local hospital where he was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m.

events.title: Failure to Conduct Security Rounds
events.description: The Correctional Officer and Materials Handler Supervisor admitted to the Operations Lieutenant that they did not conduct the mandated 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts/rounds.

events.title: BOP Internal Affairs Referral to DOJ OIG
events.description: The Bureau of Prisons Office of Internal Affairs formally referred the incident (Case OIA-2019-05324) to the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General for investigation.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
Special Housing Unit (SHU), MCC New York
Cell Z06-220 on L-tier, MCC New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York at 6:33 a.m. on August 10, 2019, and pronounced dead at a hospital at 7:36 a.m.
Two BOP staff members—a Correctional Officer and a Materials Handler Supervisor—admitted to failing to conduct the required 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate security rounds on the night of Epstein's death.
The staff involved stated they were 'traumatized' by the event and requested to contact their Union President before writing any official memorandums about the incident.

The BOP Office of Internal Affairs referred the case to the DOJ Office of the Inspector General on August 12, 2019, citing allegations including 'Endangering the Safety of an Inmate', 'Inattention to Duty', and 'Failure to Follow Policy'.
The document is an internal administrative referral, not a final investigative report, and notes that additional staff memorandums had not yet been collected at the time of referral.
